Split Expression and Metadata into Train, Test, and Inference Sets

Source: R/split_stratified_ancestry_sets.R
split_stratified_ancestry_sets.Rd

Subsamples the overrepresented ancestry (e.g., EUR) to match the underrepresented ancestry (e.g., AFR) for a test set, stratifying by metadata columns. The remaining overrepresented samples are used for training. The underrepresented ancestry group is returned as the inference set.

Usage

split_stratified_ancestry_sets(
  X,
  Y,
  MX,
  MY,
  id_col = NULL,
  stratify_cols = NULL,
  seed = NULL
)

Arguments

X

A numeric matrix (samples × features) for the overrepresented ancestry group.

Y

A numeric matrix (samples × features) for the underrepresented ancestry group.

MX

A data.frame of metadata for X (same number of rows as X).

MY

A data.frame of metadata for Y (same number of rows as Y).

id_col

Optional string specifying the column name in metadata that holds sample IDs. If NULL, rownames are used.

stratify_cols

A character vector of metadata column names to stratify on.

seed

Optional integer to set random seed for reproducibility.

Value

A named list with:

train

List with `X`, `M`, and `ids` for the remaining overrepresented samples.

test

List with `X`, `M`, and `ids` for the subsampled overrepresented group.

inference

List with `X`, `M`, and `ids` for the underrepresented ancestry group.

strata_info

A summary list with usable, missing, and insufficient strata.

Details

This version supports tracking and subsetting using either rownames or a specified sample ID column.
